Detailed Description

Author: Jaakko Luttinen GameEngine is a class for controlling the actual game simulation and the game phase.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

GameEngine::GameEngine (   ) 
 

Constructs a new game engine.

GameEngine::~GameEngine (   ) 
 

Destructs the game engine.

Member Function Documentation

void GameEngine::addPlayer (  Player &  player  ) 
 

Adds the given player in the game. Does not add same player multiple times. Game engine will clean the player's memory allocation!

Parameters:
The player to be add.

void GameEngine::draw (  Graphics &  graphics  ) 
 

Draws the world into graphics.

Parameters:
graphics The graphics object to draw to.

void GameEngine::endGame (   ) 
 

Ends the game - that is sets the status to GAMEOVER and calculates points and rankings.

Player * GameEngine::getPlayer (  int  index  ) 
 

Returns the player of given index or NULL (if invalid index).

Returns:
The player of given index or NULL for invalid index.

Tells whether the given player is in the game.

void GameEngine::nextTurn (   ) 
 

Gives the turn to next player. Mainly for game engine's own use. If used outside, it means skipping the turn.

void GameEngine::removeAllPlayers (   ) 
 

Removes all players from the game.

void GameEngine::removePlayer (  Player &  player  ) 
 

Removes the given player from the game - if it is in it.

Parameters:
player The player to remove.

void GameEngine::removePlayer (  int  index  ) 
 

Removes the player of given index from the game.

Parameters:
index The index of the player to be removed.

void GameEngine::setCallbackFunction (  void(*)(void *)  callbackFunction,
void *  parameter
) 
 

Sets the function to call at the beginning of a turn.

Parameters:
callbackFunction The function to call.
parameter The parameter for the function.

void GameEngine::setWorld (  World &  world  ) 
 

Sets the world. Game engine WILL delete the memory allocation of the world after the game.

Parameters:
world The world for the game.

void GameEngine::simulate (   ) 
 

Works "identically" with startAction, but all the changes are only simulated - no permanent changes are made. Big difference between these two functions is, that this function returns only after it has completed the simulation.

void GameEngine::startAction (   ) 
 

Starts action phase which continues until no action flagged body exists.

int GameEngine::startGame (   ) 
 

Tries to start the game.

Returns:
Return values are following: 0: start successful. -1: game already running (earlier game must end first). -2: game does not have enough players. -3: world has not been created.

void GameEngine::step (  unsigned int  timestep  ) 
 

Allows the game engine to work. Depending on the game status the engine will do a bit different things.

Parameters:
timestep Delay since last call (ms).
